meanings.def: at what time; on what occasion
examples: When did you last see him?
When can I see you?
When (= in what circumstances) would such a solution be possible?

meanings.def: used after an expression of time to mean ‘at which’ or ‘on which’
examples: Sunday is the only day when I can relax.
There are times when I wonder why I do this job.

meanings.def: at which time; on which occasion
examples: The last time I went to Scotland was in May, when the weather was beautiful.

related: When the Saints Go Marching In
when the shit hits the fan
when he’s, it’s, etc. at home
when all is said and done

examples: Until when can you stay?
‘I've got a new job.’ ‘Since when?’

meanings.def: at or during the time that
examples: I loved history when I was at school.
Call me when you've finished.
Can you spare five minutes when it's convenient?
He had just drifted off to sleep when the phone rang.
How can they expect to learn anything when they never listen?
She claimed to be 18, when I know she's only 16.

meanings.def: used to say that something may happen at some time in the future, but only when something else has happened
examples: We'll decide on the team as and when we qualify.
I'll tell you more as and when (= as soon as I can).

meanings.def: used to say something about an event that may or may not happen
examples: If and when we ever meet again I hope he remembers what I did for him.

idioms.def: used to say that something may happen at some time in the future, but only when something else has happened
examples: We'll decide on the team as and when we qualify.
I'll tell you more as and when (= as soon as I can).

idioms.def: used to say something about an event that may or may not happen
examples: If and when we ever meet again I hope he remembers what I did for him.
